title: Drawing, "Design for Sculpture: Ang", late 17th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on white laid paper laid down
inscribed: inscribed in pen and brown ink, right edge: 42
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: An angel stands contrapposto atop a plinth, head turned to the left while blowing into a serpentine horn terminating in the head of a beast.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Sculpture: Ang", late 17th century.
late 17th century. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on white laid paper laid down. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2213.
